descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Material inequality is central to many contemporary global conflicts, injustices, and political dynamics. The differential distribution of resources, wealth, and access to finance has roots in colonial history and is maintained by a set of powerful governing institutions, ideas, and practices. Extremes disparities in wealth in poverty in the global South and North are at the root of differences in health outcomes, educational opportunity, land ownership, patterns of migration, employment prospects and protections, and environmental impact. Why is our world so unequal? What are the effects of inequality on lived experience, culture, the social and physical environment, and conflict? Is it ethical to live a world with a high degree of material inequality? What can be done to mitigate inequality?
